intro: Alsinanthus rigidus, commonly known as rigid flixweed, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and has small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often covered in fine hairs. Alsinanthus rigidus is an annual herb that is often found in fields, roadsides, and along stream banks.
